To mark the start of #ChildrensMentalHealthWeek these shoes on the steps of St George's Hall represent the 226 school children who lost their lives to suicide in 2017.

Sad Statistics:
Suicide is the 10th leading cause of death in the US for all ages. (CDC)

Every day, approximately 123 Americans die by suicide. (CDC)

There is one death by suicide in the US every 12 minutes. (CDC)

Depression affects 20-25% of Americans ages 18+ in a given year. (CDC)

Suicide takes the lives of over 44,965 Americans every year. (CDC)

If you have ANY concerns about a student in the Holliston Public Schools, please tell a trusted adult. There is always help available and people who care about you. You are NOT alone and you ARE loved.

#raisingawareness

Welcome Back for the 2019-2020 school year.

This year, Holliston, like all near-by school districts, is facing a critical shortage of Substitute Teachers. In the past, we have found that many of our most-effective and supportive Substitutes are Holliston residents who are either seeking part-time, school-year employment; are looking to ease back into the workforce; or are looking for ways to actively support their community and their schools. Regardless of your motivation, being a Substitute Teacher is an excellent way to work with Holliston’s great teachers and school staff and, of course, our remarkable students.

The Holliston Public Schools is hosting an Open House for those who want to learn more about this exciting opportunity. Join us on Thursday, September 5, 2019 at 7PM in the Holliston High School Library to learn more!

Please share this information with your neighbors and friends.

Hope to see you there!

The Holliston Police Department is saddened to report that the missing Holliston resident, ROBERT A. VALLI, age 53, was found deceased in the Town of Milford, MA early this morning. Members of the Holliston Fire Department, Holliston Police Department and the Holliston Public Schools responded immediately and, following Massachusetts State Police Bomb Threat Protocols, closed the area off from student and staff access and conducted a thorough search. Although not required by Protocol, out of an abundance of caution, we were able to secure resources from the State Police Bomb Squad assigned to the State Fire Marshal’s Office to conduct an additional search of the specified area. Again, no suspicious items were identified and the closed off area was reopened.

The Holliston Police Department’s School Resource Officer and Holliston High School administration will conduct a thorough investigation into this incident. Anyone with pertinent information is encouraged to contact the Holliston Police Department.

Be nice. Be patient. It's everyone's Halloween!

shared_text:
Carolyn Dykema
March 16, 2017 at 5:25 PM ·

This morning I was happy to meet with Holliston High senior Megan Burke, who came into the State House as part of a briefing on Project 351. Project 351 is a statewide initiative that brings together young people from almost all 351 cities and towns in the Commonwealth to collaborate on service opportunities and harness critical leadership skills through a year-long program. Project 351 is a great opportunity for both town ambassadors and other young people in the community, and I look forward to connecting with it more in the future.

Megan is an exemplary Project 351 alumna. A member of the Alumni Leadership Team, Megan spoke of her years of involvement with Project 351 as well as her own initiative, The Beautiful Mind Campaign. The Beautiful Mind Campaign, which Megan started at Holliston High, works to destigmatize mental illness and support wellness for adolescents, who face increasing pressure at school and home both. I was so impressed by Megan’s passion and empathy, and was thrilled to get a chance to meet with her and her mom Lynn!

REMINDER ! Parent/Guardian Workshop on Mindfulness - Tuesday November 29, 2016 7-8 PM at Miller Elementary School
We are pleased to invite parents/guardians to a Parent/Guardian Education Evening on the topic of Mindfulness. Secular mindfulness strategies are increasingly being used in education and other fields to support positive well-being. Research studies support that Mindfulness has positive impacts on the brain, relationships, and physical and mental health.
Educators in Holliston are beginning to learn how to use some of these techniques and learn about the benefits in the classroom. We would like to extend this learning to interested parents/guardians.
The presentation is tailored toward parents/guardians of elementary students, however middle school and high school parents/guardians are certainly welcome as well.
